programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 28 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jake Piseno joins the show! After Saturday's thrilling win over the Atlas, Jake describes just how special this Outlaws team is. Jake talks growing up in Syracuse, and why his favorite school growing up did not recruit him. The boys recap a crazy weekend in the PLL. Was Hoagie right about CJ Kirst? Doogs updates his MVP rankings. Is Coach Tierney on the hot seat? All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: MASTERCHEF returns for an exciting fifth season, giving talented home cooks from all walks of life the chance to showcase their skills, knowledge and passion in front of the shows esteemed judging panel: Gordon Ramsay, Joe Bastianich and Graham Elliot. After a nationwide search, 30 of the best home cooks in America present their signature dish to the judges, but only the Top Finalists will earn a coveted white apron and compete for a chance to win the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the first mystery box challenge of the season, the Top Finalists will have 90 minutes to prep and cook a unique and impressive dish, using mainly dessert ingredients.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 16 face off in their first team challenge, during which they cook lunch for first responders. Each team will have to create a dish featuring a delicious filet mignon and the guests will vote on which is better the team with the most votes will win the challenge. Then, its up to the judges to determine which two cooks from the losing team will head home.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 14 receive a mystery box challenge inspired by the White House garden from former First Lady Michelle Obama. The young cooks must come up with an original recipe that is both healthy and presidential worthy, and the winner will receive a special once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! For the next challenge, Julie Bowen (Modern Family) steps into the MASTERCHEF kitchen to watch the kids make a dish in honor of their moms. Then, its up to the judges to decide which contestant will go home.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to a few of the restaurants to see if they took his advice. The eateries he visits include Mojito, The Junction (formerly Flamango's) and Bazzini.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to Lido di Manhattan, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro to see if the owners have implemented his changes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs compete to cook for an Olympian and an NFL star.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams prepare a post-wedding brunch for 15 couples.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining 20 home cooks compete in the biggest field challenge in MASTERCHEF history: feeding an army of 500 servicemen and women on a desert army base.

programme.desc: Guest judge Richard Blais enters the kitchen to see what the kids can cook up. In the first challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks team up into groups of three and have 10 minutes to make as many pies as possible. The winning team will be safe from elimination and will get to give the judges a sweet surprise! Then, its up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home?

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, keeping on top of seasonal maintenance as well as enjoying the plants of high summer. Adam Frost travels to Sissinghurst Castle Gardens to view a new area of the garden which was inspired by a visit to the Greek island of Delos, and in Berkshire we find out how one gardener keeps her garden full of interest in every season of the year. In West Sussex, we get tips on growing the perfect dahlia from a grower with over 50 years of experience.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Nick Bailey celebrate gardeners throughout the country who have created some truly unique gardens and made every space count. Carol meets a couple in Dorset whose garden is full of inspirational features.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, enjoying the colours of late summer in the garden. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Frances Tophill get an exclusive preview of Gardeners' World Live at the NEC.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow with plenty of seasonal advice to keep gardens colourful. Will Young shows off his south London courtyard garden and reveals why it has become an absolute joy in his life, and Joe Swift helps him create some seasonal pot displays for sunny and shady spots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets some shrubs in the ground and plans ahead for spring with some bulb planting. Meanwhile, Frances Tophill joins Sue Kent on her allotment to find out how her growing year has been.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Macks Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. Well even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Macks employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. Its timber holes and tall tales. Its cups of coffee and cupped up wings. Its partners in business, and partners in potholes and its pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode well tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, well head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. Well talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. Well also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site well chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, well learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at Johns lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interluxs paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team highlighted deck repair and antique motor restoration, including storage solutions and structural enhancements.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slades dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home dcor.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didnt expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesnt work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, thats where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish shes never caught before. Lo and behold, its a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting campeach with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isnt all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT Barry has Slades brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on lets see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT Barry has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. Its time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Embark on an epic journey into the world of legendary snook fishing with 'Legendary Snook Chronicles: Captain Mike Anderson's Reel Odyssey.' Join the seasoned angler, Captain Mike Anderson, as he takes you on an adrenaline-pumping adventure through the waters, revealing the secrets of reeling in these elusive giants.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike shares Tampa Bay's secrets with young anglers of his Jr. Pro Staff team, teaching the importance of patience and respect an angler. The smiles on their faces are lasting proof of how rewarding it can be to bring up the next generation.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Return to the Redfish Haven. Armed with Strike King lures, Mike and his team embark on an exciting angling adventure, targeting massive redfish in the Louisiana Delta. Don't miss this thrilling journey through challenging waters and breathtaking landscapes in pursuit of the ultimate Bayou beast.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is bass fishing out on West Lake Toho with Capt. Tony Summers. Bass Beware!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Vietnam war veteran Tim Smith recounts his time in Vietnam and surviving a direct hit by a missile.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It has been a hell of a week in Mexico but the guys aren't done yet. They still have some time to lay some critters down!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting campeach with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing inferior bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Seasoned bowhunter Bob Robb remains humble as he faces a reality that no amount of practicing can ever fully eliminate.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills Stomper,Jr. and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. We thoroughly enjoyed chasing this magnificent animal in Louisiana with our good buddies Drew Keith and Cole Cooper. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxlers life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. Well take a look into Nikkis life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. Well also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Macks Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. Well even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Macks employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. Its timber holes and tall tales. Its cups of coffee and cupped up wings. Its partners in business, and partners in potholes and its pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Follow Chris Scmidt, one of the newest members of Team200 as he chases big bucks from the East Coast to the Midwest!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slades dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Get ready to embark on an exhilarating fishing expedition as Mike Anderson, the renowned host of Reel Animals TV, teams up with two dynamic and skilled female captains, Katie Jo and Lezia Fitzgerald, on the stunning Nature Coast of Florida.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Embark on an epic journey into the world of legendary snook fishing with 'Legendary Snook Chronicles: Captain Mike Anderson's Reel Odyssey.' Join the seasoned angler, Captain Mike Anderson, as he takes you on an adrenaline-pumping adventure through the waters, revealing the secrets of reeling in these elusive giants.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike shares Tampa Bay's secrets with young anglers of his Jr. Pro Staff team, teaching the importance of patience and respect an angler. The smiles on their faces are lasting proof of how rewarding it can be to bring up the next generation.

Don't miss this thrilling journey through challenging waters and breathtaking landscapes in pursuit of the ultimate Bayou beast.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara spend the last night of the year on the ice chasing crappies after dark!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara head north to Cliff Lake in NW Ontario. Cliff is known for its smallie fishing and the pre-spawn bite does not disappoint.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by John McCune for blue line fishing with Tad Murdock. Later they explore Helen Georgia during Oktoberfest.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins Capt. Tucker Ersek and his father for a day of sail fishing off Ocean Reef in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared makes his way to Bolivar, Texas with Clay Guest & Ryan Pyburn.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins legendary Captains Donny Lange and Charlie Scoble offshore in Islamorada.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we arent talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Josephs Bay on Blacks Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode well tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, well head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. Well talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. Well also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site well chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, well learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: After booking a trip at the last Indian River Clam Restoration banquete, the guys at Gold Key Roofing got a chance to fish with Capt. Blair and Capt. Mike Frenette.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at Johns lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interluxs paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, David Genat is cruising the Caribbean through the US and British Virgin Islands before finishing up in colorful and vibrant Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home dcor.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didnt expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesnt work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, thats where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish shes never caught before. Lo and behold, its a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting campeach with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isnt all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT Barry has Slades brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on lets see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT Barry has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we arent talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Josephs Bay on Blacks Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode well tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, well head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. Well talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. Well also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site well chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, well learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: After booking a trip at the last Indian River Clam Restoration banquete, the guys at Gold Key Roofing got a chance to fish with Capt. Blair and Capt. Mike Frenette.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at Johns lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interluxs paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, David Genat is cruising the Caribbean through the US and British Virgin Islands before finishing up in colorful and vibrant Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.desc: A mass-transit engineer faces the horrors of relocating his family from his lifelong home in New Jersey when hes offered a dream job in Boise, Idaho.

programme.title: Memoirs Of An Invisible Man
programme.desc: A nuclear accident turns a successful businessman invisible - a change that proves more of a burden than gift.

programme.title: The Mummy Lives
programme.desc: An ancient mummy returns from the dead and becomes obsessed with a woman he believes is his dead lover.

programme.title: Curly Sue
programme.desc: Conning people on the streets to survive, an orphan and her down-and-out guardian try to pull a scam on a jaded attorney ready to open her heart.

programme.title: Her Alibi
programme.desc: A mild-mannered mystery novelist meets a woman accused of murder and supplies her with an alibi.

programme.title: Martian Child
programme.desc: Based on an award-winning short story, this romantic drama follows a recently-widowed sci-fi writer who forms an unlikely family with a close friend.

programme.title: 8 Seconds
programme.desc: Dreams and perseverance lead to an Oklahoma boy's meteoric rise as a champion bull rider in this film about the life of pro rodeo cowboy Lane Frost.

programme.title: Ladyhawke
programme.desc: A medieval pickpocket who escapes the noose becomes indebted to a shapeshifting knight and his star-crossed lover on a revenge quest to kill a bishop.

programme.title: Pleasantville
programme.desc: Two teens are transported into the black-and-white world of a 1950s sitcom.

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A woman sets off on a madcap quest to find the person guilty of the crime for which she served the time.

programme.title: First Target
programme.desc: A group of deadly assassins targets the US President as he tours a state park aboard a tram, and it's up to Secret Service agent, Alex, to stop them.

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Sent to spend the summer on a remote and mysterious island, brothers embark on a thrilling treasure hunt to restore their family's lost fortune.

programme.title: I'll Do Anything
programme.desc: Character actor Matt Hobbs finds himself struggling to make ends meet when his ex-wife unexpectedly makes him responsible for their 6-year-old kid.

programme.title: To Write Love on Her Arms
programme.desc: Based on the life of Renee Yohe, who battled drugs, depression, and issues, that led to the founding of the charity group To Write Love on Her Arms.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: Raising Waylon
programme.desc: A restaurateur (Thomas Gibson) and a photographer (Poppy Montgomery) learn surprising things about themselves while taking care of their 9-year-old godchild.

programme.title: No Mercy
programme.desc: A Chicago cop looking to avenge the death of his partner heads to New Orleans and kidnaps the killer's mistress by handcuffing himself to her.

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: Interpol agent Louis Salinger and New York Assistant District Attorney Eleanor Whitman track a high-stakes international money trail.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic 80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter hes testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: Cops and Robbersons

programme.title: Stealing Harvard

programme.title: Dear Eleanor

programme.title: To Gillian on Her 37th Birthday
programme.desc: After the death of his loving wife, David is torn by grief, and has been fixating on her spirit. Now he must let go of her in order to move on.

programme.title: Calendar Girl
programme.desc: It's 1962 and three friends just out of high school journey to Hollywood determined to meet the object of their shared obsession: Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: Perfect

programme.title: Blonde Ambition
programme.desc: After small-town Katie follows her fiance to New York and catches him with another woman, she rebounds with a dream job that isn't what it appears.

programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorce with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Sunset

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiance, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced theyre the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Beyond Mombasa
programme.desc: When his brother dies during a uranium mining mission in East Africa, a hard-drinking American makes his way there to suss out his killers.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acua (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Three for the Show
programme.desc: Widowed by World War I, a Broadway star remarries her late husband's songwriting partner only to have the first one turn up very much alive.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Hoedown
programme.desc: An ex-movie cowboy (Jack O'Mahoney) and a newswoman (Jeff Donnell) rope bank robbers at a singer's (Eddy Arnold) dude ranch.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Tulsa
programme.desc: When a rancher dies during a feud with a big oil company, his daughter takes revenge by digging her own wells, assisted by an expert and a friend.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Terror Trail
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) heads off a range war over cattle and sheep.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Whirlwind Raiders
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) stop bogus Texas lawmen.

programme.title: The New Daughters of Joshua Cabe
programme.desc: While posing as his daughters, three women discover an elderly homesteader has been falsely imprisoned for murder and hatch a plot to smuggle him out.

programme.title: Cyclone Fury
programme.desc: The Durango Kid puts the skids on a bandit bent on sabotaging an Indian's bid for a government contract.

Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Savage Pampas
programme.desc: To tame the plains of Argentina, dominated by bandits and Indigenous warriors, an army captain brings in a party of women to keep his soldiers happy.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.desc: Two highly trained teenage assassins have to get real jobs as a cover, and become roommates.

programme.desc: The BAU tracks a vigilante in Los Angeles who is shooting people with possible ties to criminal activity.

programme.desc: The team suspects Kate's niece and her friend were kidnapped by an online predator involved in sex trafficking and race to find them before they are hurt.

programme.desc: The team must find the person responsible for a sarin gas attack on a Los Angeles bus before a larger incident occurs.

programme.desc: A murder in a Florida community of sex offenders results in a large number of possible suspects; a career opportunity could take Lewis away from the BAU.
